headline: Easy Buffalo Chicken Dip
description: Converting the idea of Buffalo-style chicken wings to a dip that can be served with chips, crackers, or vegetables is the genesis of this recipe perfectly tailored to your next football-watching party or even Oscars night!
name: Easy Buffalo Chicken Dip
recipeIngredient: 1 (15 ounce) jar chunky-style blue cheese salad dressing (such as Marzetti®)
1 (12 ounce) bottle Buffalo wing sauce (such as Frank's RedHot®)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Stir together blue cheese salad dressing and cream cheese in a mixing bowl until smooth. Stir in chicken, Buffalo wing sauce, and blue cheese crumbles; pour chicken mixture into a baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until bubbling, 15 to 20 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Fantastic! I roasted bone in, skin on chicken breasts and then used that tender meat for the dip. I followed everything else in this recipe. We all loved it and I will definitely make it again.

I kind of used this as a starter recipe which made it easy and took into account some of the reviews! It didn’t seem to have enough sauce for our taste so I basically tripled it! I used almost two full 16 oz bottles of buffalo sauce, 2 packets of Ranch dressing (daughter hates blue cheese), 1 package 8 oz softened cream cheese, about 1 1/2 cups of shredded cheese and 3 large chicken breasts shredded. I mixed it all leaving 1/2 cup shredded cheese for topping. Put it all in the dish and baked at 375 for 25 min and it was AMAZING!

Followed the directions, except I only used maybe half of the buffalo sauce. just made sure to choose brands I knew Had good ingredients, then I felt good about eating it. Didn’t last long at the potluck table, it was a hit.

I made this for a gathering of my Allrecipeeps, and it was a big winner. I baked bone-in skin-on chicken breasts seasoned with Papa's Seasoning blend from this site and then shredded the meat (makes gloriously tasty moist chicken). I couldn't find the Marzetti brand of blue cheese dressing so used a different brand. Otherwise I followed the recipe. Be sure to warn people who can't handle spicy heat very well because it is spicy. But oh-so-delicious! Winner!
Very quick and so good! Followed recipe exactly.
This was a great and easy recipe! Everyone loved it!
Can of chicken is an easy swap. (Drain the chicken)

Fantastic yet simple recipe. Aside from the shredding of the chicken, this was as simple as dumping the ingredients into a bowl, then baking. If you are reading this, give this a try.

ONE WARNING: Warn your guests that this dip is hot. Spicy hot (and maybe temp hot, too). We had a guest load up their tortilla chips with the dip expecting cheesy and was taken back by the heat. It is a wonderful flavor, sure to please, but make sure your guests know what they are getting.

Will make this again and again. Perfect dip for those who like buffalo chicken! Only comment on the recipe is "3 chicken breasts" is too vague for me. We have 1lb breasts and 3lbs of chicken would be a bit too much. Wished it was stated in cups or better yet ounces.
Followed recipe only changed time to 25 minutes. Turned out great! Was a big hit! Will definitely make it again!
So quick and easy!! I've made it several times! I did however substitute the Franks hot sauce, for Texas Pete's.

This was a big hit. My brother even asked for the recipe, and I don't think he's ever done that before. We live in the Buffalo area, so the bleu cheese in the recipe resonated with me. So many wing-dip recipes call for ranch dressing. I used Frank's Hot Sauce for that authentic Buffalo wing taste. I found that it needed to cook just a bit longer or at a slightly higher temperature to get it nice and hot all the way through. 15-20 minutes was not long enough.
Loved this recipe and so did everyone else! Simple and easy.
it's and awesome recipe you could also use pita bread with it
very easy and delicious buff chick dip recipe
I used Sriracha sauce for the buffalo flavoring. Instead of bleu cheese crumbles on top I used Cabot cheddar

Loved it! I'm used to making buffalo chicken dip w/ ranch, so this was a nice change. I topped the dip w/ some shredded cheddar and more blue cheese before baking. I did play around w/ the ratios a bit b/c I didn't want to make THAT much. Everyone loved it~YUM! Thanks for sharing. :)
Thank you for posting! Excellent recipe.
